item.title: [ 43] Xenoblade
item.description:
I think action combat going forward is the logical choice. The MMO faux style combat just needs to go. They've taken it as far as it can go and I've had my fill of it. People just don't like it. I'm tired of the series not gaining a footing with more gamers cause they hate the combat.

Nobody is doing that MMO style because 1.) It's dated, and 2.) Its not compatible with a wider audience. It's not "unique" either, it's a system lifted straight out of MMOs.

I don't *hate* the Xenoblade combat, but I also wouldn't miss it. It's not the sole reason I play Xenoblade. There's so much more to these games than just it's combat. Most of the mechanics can be translated into an action battle system anyway.

Original filename: featured-image-every-game-in-the-xenoblade-series-ranked.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [129] Stop whining. If you wanted to buy Resident Evil 4 on January 25th 2005, you'd
item.description:
Stop whining. If you wanted to buy Resident Evil 4 on January 25th 2005, you'd have to spend the equivalent of USD$90 adjusted for inflation.

If you weren't a rich, spoiled suburban white kid, you were not even able to game.

Nowadays, gaming is more and more accessible and way cheaper.

Stop complaining about prices. Enjoy your games and your unlimited options.

Original filename: Screenshot_20250508_205916_Gallery.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [136] What happened to Splatoon?
item.description:
Splatoon 3 was great but for some reason it just kinda fell off for me. It just didn't stick like 1 and 2 did.
I can't put my finger on it but it's kind of feels like how Animal Crossing New Horizons didn't stick with me.

item.title: [ 67] /nrl/ - Rugby League General - Friday Night Footy - round 10
item.description:
Still friends edition

NRL
>GAME 1
Newcastle Knights v Gold Coast Titans
6:00pm AEST on Fox and Kayo
McDonald Jones Stadium, Newcastle
1.46-2.74
>The Knights returned to the winner's list with an impressive win at Magic Round, while the Titans will be boosted by the return of Jayden Campbell. Newcastle ended a five-match losing streak with a dominant Magic Round 30-4 demolition of the Rabbitohs, breaking a losing run that started with a 26-6 defeat to the Titans in round 3. Gold Coast have now lost five straight, including a 20 point loss to the Bulldogs last weekend, and sit 16th on the ladder. The Titans defeated the Knights 26-6 earlier this season, but have not beaten them in Newcastle in their last six attempts, with their last win over the Knights at this venue being back in 2016.
Knights 1-12 2.85
Knights 13+ 2.60
Titans 1-12 3.75
Titans 13+ 7.00
Knights -6.5 1.96 Titans +5.5 1.85

>GAME 2
South Sydney Rabbitohs v Brisbane Broncos
8:05pm AEST on Fox, Kayo and Ch9
Accor Stadium, Sydney
3.82-1.27
>A nice coaching twist to this game. Wayne Bennett guided the Broncos to six titles & Michael Maguire was successful in 2014 with the Rabbitohs. South Sydney’s woes continued with a 30-4 defeat to Newcastle, their fourth in a row and keeping them anchored near the bottom of the table. Brisbane followed up a commanding win over ladder-leaders Canterbury with a deflating 32-8 loss to the Panthers. Ezra Mam’s nine-week suspension is over, but he returns via Queensland Cup. The Rabbitohs have been dominant in recent H2H meetings at Accor Stadium, winning four out of five, with the Broncos victorious on only two occasions.
Rabbitohs 1-12 4.80
Rabbitohs 13+ 10.50
Broncos 1-12 2.90
Broncos 13+ 2.02
Rabbitohs +10.5 1.88 Broncos -10.5 1.92

Original filename: Friends.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [156] Viv could've had a more interesting story if she portrayed her demons in Helluv
item.description:
Viv could've had a more interesting story if she portrayed her demons in Helluva Boss existing under an oppressive culture that rewards cruelty and cynicism while discouraging sincere affection and love resulting in many hellborn quickly melting in response to genuine empathy like viltrumites. It would have even fit her liberal ideals of fighting against oppressive power structures. I find it notable and odd then that her characters not only rub elbows with those in power so often but that said authority figures are portrayed so sympathetically and benevolently. We still see shades of her wanting to portray Blitzo as a "working class hero" but the narrative she set up is (unsurprisingly) schizophrenic and directionless.
Also Stolas is a shit.

Original filename: nword.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 54] US-UK Trade Deal
item.description:
UK and US announce trade deal to save thousands of British jobs, Starmer says

https://news.sky.com/story/uk-and-us-agree-trade-deal-as-starmer-and-trump-make-announcement-in-live-phone-call-13363710

The UK and US have agreed a trade deal, with Sir Keir Starmer and Donald Trump confirming the announcement during a live televised phone call.

It is the first trade deal agreed after Mr Trump began his second presidential term in January, and after he imposed strict tariffs on countries around the world in April.

Sir Keir said the "first-of-a-kind" deal with the US will save thousands of jobs across the UK, boost British business and protect British industry.

Original filename: starmer_trump.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [384] =POMF= (what are we doing) at (the bed) roll?
item.description:
It's been a long vacation, PAW Patrol friends. It's unfortunate that 4chan didn't come back on a little bit earlier last week since it seems Badway was, as they say, an S-tier episode over there. Anyway, this week's Jap ep is two new subseries eps, Pups Stop a Junk-Monster and Twisty Top Mesa. PAW Party 2025 is announced, coming 7/11, and of course one of the episodes is Ryder's Surprise. A big event with Yokohama is happening, with the first appearance of the Rocky and Zuma mascots. Lots of toys are out, including everyone's favorite humping trio.

On the Western side, Season 11 is almost done. Skye's Roadtrip is this weekend, and then the long-awaited Zuma dream ep next week.

Super PAW Patrol thread, start!

Original filename: Gn5x-5QbAAAYFh5[1].jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 37] Hey voyagers, The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread
item.description:
Hey voyagers,

The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread open for suggestions:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/trv/ is a slow board, so don't expect immediate responses. CHECK THE CATALOG – you might find threads already discussing topics you're interested in.

Before asking for suggestions, tell /trv/ about your:
>Budget
>Interests
>Level of understanding of the local language(s)
This makes it easier to give quality advice. Of course, keep your posts travel related.

For all other matters:
General culture questions >>>/int/
Politics discussion >>>/pol/
Transportation discussion >>>/n/
Outdoors-related discussion >>>/out/

For more information about safety, planning and other miscellaneous topics, check out the pastebin:

GENERAL INFO:
https://pastebin.com/yR1SAr3s

Note: Discussions of prostitution or sex tourism are not permitted on /trv/.

Original filename: trv.png
item.author: Anonymous
